titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 1088: Apparatus domini Bernardi Raymundi in sexto libro decretalium

notesStmt.note: Title from incipit for first work (f. 1r); alternate title from scrap of binding material pasted on the first page of the collection of leaves.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Partial copy of commentaries by Bernardus Raymundus and Garsias Hispanus on the Liber sextus, a major collection of decretals published by Pope Boniface VIII in 1298; includes some marginal annotations, and has a list of the virtues of an unidentified herb and a short apocryphal Passion text (f. 51r-v).

msItem.title: Apparatus domini Bernardi Raymundi in sexto libro decretalium

author.persName: Garsias, Hispanus, Bishop of Sigüenza, fl. 1277-1299

msItem.title: Notes on an unknown herb, f. 51r

collation.p: Parchment, 51; 1-2¹² 3¹¹(+11) 4⁴ 5¹²; [1-51]; modern foliation in pencil, lower right recto. Catchwords present on lower right verso of quires 1-4, those in quire 3 apply to the additional page of the quire; quires missing between 2 and 3 and between 3 and 4.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns of 61 lines, ruled in lead.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a rounded Gothic book script; annotations, list, and apocryphal text written in a Gothic cursive script.

decoDesc.decoNote: Puzzle initial with J-chain in red and blue, 11-line (f. 1r), 13-line (f. 27r), 3-line (f. 38r); pen-flourished 2 line initials throughout, small sketches of faces in profile as well as various grotesques in the margins, including a dragon (f. 39r).

history.provenance: Quires 1-3 sold by Laurence Witten (New Haven, Conn.), 1959.
Quires 4-5 sold by Laurence Witten (Southport, Conn.), 1980.
